keyword: how many calories in a cappuccino
title: How Many Calories Are in a Cappuccino?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cappuccino, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat, plus variations and FAQs for your coffee routine.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Cappuccino?
assumptions: Standard 150 ml cappuccino with whole milk, single espresso shot, no added sugar or flavors; steamed milk and foam.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type, size, coffee strength, added sweeteners, and cafe preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard cappuccino has about 80 kcal, mostly from milk.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use skim milk instead of whole

faqs.q: How many calories in a cappuccino with whole milk?
faqs.a: About 80 kcal for a standard 150 ml serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cappuccino?
faqs.a: Around 5 g, mainly from the milk.
Yes, about 6 g from lactose in the milk.

faqs.q: How to make a low-calorie cappuccino?
faqs.a: Opt for skim or plant-based milk and skip sugar to reduce to ~50 kcal.
A 240 ml version can have 120-150 kcal depending on milk and additions.
